Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different plants and animals, including humans, in their natural habitats.
The student can include labels to show where different plants and animals live (e.g., fish in water, deer in a forest).
The student can draw and label the resources that plants and animals need to survive (e.g., water, air, sunlight, leaves, etc.).
The student can show how the environments of plants and animals help meet their needs (e.g., fish swim and breathe in water).
The student can illustrate and label how animals and plants interact with their environment, showing that they are part of a system (e.g., plants in sunlight, animals eating plants).
